alert.note: Alert for Steele; Waseca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 3:40PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Steele and east central Waseca Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 339 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Waseca, or 12 miles west of Owatonna, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Owatonna. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 39 and 41. U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 158 and 173. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
